ref: 7528 nistarati ʻ comes forth ʼ MBh. [MIA. and NIA. forms with tth ~ tt are prob. dial. (cf. níṣkramati) and not < ni -- str̥ -- ND 345 a 25. -- &rcirclemacr Pa. nittharati ʻ comes out, crosses over, leaves behind ʼ; Pk. ṇittharaï ʻ comes through ʼ, caus. ṇittharēi; L. nitraṇ ʻ to be refined ʼ, awāṇ. nitruṇ ʻ to be separated ʼ; P. nittarnā ʻ to go aside, be squeezed, be clarified ʼ, ḍog. nittharnã̄ ʻ to be distilled ʼ; WPah. (Joshi) nitrṇu ʻ to dry by letting drop ʼ; Ku. nitarṇo, nitharṇo ʻ to fall in drops, drip, leak ʼ; N. nitalnu ʻ to continue pressing for juice after the juice has been extracted ʼ; B. nitalāni ʻ free from dregs ʼ; H. nitharnā ʻ to be made clear ʼ; G. nitarvũ ʻ to ooze, settle ʼ; M. nitarṇẽ, nitharṇẽ ʻ to run off (of liquids) ʼ, nitaḷ, nithaḷ ʻ clear, limpid ʼ.
